00010 //##          1.03 of 15-Feb-96: Changes for 16 bit callbacks and multiple  ##
00011 //##                             16 bit DLL loads (JKR)                     ##
00012 //##          1.04 of  2-Nov-97: Changes made to handle DLS in future       ##
00013 //##                             versions                                   ##
00014 //##          1.05 of  1-Jan-98: Massive changes for version 4.0            ##
00015 //##          1.06 of 17-Sep-98: Massive changes for version 5.0            ##

00520 #define SSD_EOD_CALLBACK  0  // Application end-of-data callback if not NULL
00521 #define VOC_BLK_PTR       1  // Pointer to current block
00522 #define VOC_REP_BLK       2  // Pointer to beginning of repeat loop block
00523 #define VOC_N_REPS        3  // # of iterations left in repeat loop
00524 #define VOC_MARKER        4  // Marker to search for, or -1 if all
00525 #define VOC_MARKER_FOUND  5  // Desired marker found if 1, else 0
00526 #define SSD_RELEASE       6  // Release sample handle upon termination if >0
00527 #ifdef IS_WINDOWS
00528 #define SSD_EOD_CB_WIN32S 7  // Application end-of-data callback is in Win32s
00529 #else
00530 #define SSD_TEMP          7  // Temporary storage location for general use
00531 #endif

00536 
00537 #define AILT_FREE         0         // Timer handle is free for allocation
00538 #define AILT_STOPPED      1         // Timer is stopped
00539 #define AILT_RUNNING      2         // Timer is running

00541 //
00542 // SAMPLE.status flag values
00543 //
00544 
00545 #define SMP_FREE          0x0001    // Sample is available for allocation
00546 
00547 #define SMP_DONE          0x0002    // Sample has finished playing, or has
00548                                     // never been started
00549 
00550 #define SMP_PLAYING       0x0004    // Sample is playing
00551 
00552 #define SMP_STOPPED       0x0008    // Sample has been stopped
00553 
00554 #define SMP_PLAYINGBUTRELEASED 0x0010 // Sample is playing, but digital handle
00555                                       // has been temporarily released
00556 
00557 
00558 
00559 //
00560 // SEQUENCE.status flag values
00561 //
00562 
00563 #define SEQ_FREE          0x0001    // Sequence is available for allocation
00564 
00565 #define SEQ_DONE          0x0002    // Sequence has finished playing, or has
00566                                     // never been started
00567 
00568 #define SEQ_PLAYING       0x0004    // Sequence is playing
00569 
00570 #define SEQ_STOPPED       0x0008    // Sequence has been stopped
00571 
00572 #define SEQ_PLAYINGBUTRELEASED 0x0010 // Sequence is playing, but MIDI handle
00573                                       // has been temporarily released

00902 typedef struct _AILSOUNDINFO {
00903   S32 format;
00904   void const FAR* data_ptr;
00905   U32 data_len;
00906   U32 rate;
00907   S32 bits;
00908   S32 channels;
00909   U32 samples;
00910   U32 block_size;
00911   void const FAR* initial_ptr;
00912 } AILSOUNDINFO;
00913 
00914 
00915 // for multi-processor machines
00916 
00917 #ifdef IS_WIN32
00918 
00919 #ifdef BUILD_MSS
00920 
00921   #define MSSLockedIncrement(var) _asm { lock inc [var] }
00922   #define MSSLockedDecrement(var) _asm { lock dec [var] }
00923 
00924   static void __MSSLockedIncrementAddr(void * addr)
00925   {
00926     _asm
00927     {
00928       mov eax,[addr]
00929       lock inc dword ptr [eax]
00930     }
00931   }
00932 
00933   static void __MSSLockedDecrementAddr(void * addr)
00934   {
00935     _asm {
00936       mov eax,[addr]
00937       lock dec dword ptr [eax]
00938     }
00939   }
00940 
00941   #define MSSLockedIncrementPtr(var) __MSSLockedIncrementAddr(&(var))
00942   #define MSSLockedDecrementPtr(var) __MSSLockedDecrementAddr(&(var))
00943 
00944 #else
00945 
00946   #define MSSLockedIncrement(var) (++var)
00947   #define MSSLockedDecrement(var) (--var)
00948 
00949   #define MSSLockedIncrementPtr(var) (++var)
00950   #define MSSLockedDecrementPtr(var) (--var)
00951 
00952 #endif
00953 
00954 #else
00955   #define MSSLockedIncrement(var) (++var)
00956   #define MSSLockedDecrement(var) (--var)
00957 
00958   #define MSSLockedIncrementPtr(var) (++var)
00959   #define MSSLockedDecrementPtr(var) (--var)
00960 #endif

00962 #ifndef RIB_H        // RIB.H contents included if RIB.H not already included
00963 
00964 // #include "rib.h"
00965 
00966 #define RIB_H
00967 #define ARY_CNT(x) (sizeof((x)) / sizeof((x)[0]))
00968 
00969 // ----------------------------------
00970 // RIB data types
00971 // ----------------------------------
00972 
00973 typedef S32 RIBRESULT;
00974 
00975 #define RIB_NOERR                    0   // Success -- no error
00976 #define RIB_NOT_ALL_AVAILABLE        1   // Some requested functions/attribs not available
00977 #define RIB_NOT_FOUND                2   // Resource not found
00978 #define RIB_OUT_OF_MEM               3   // Out of system RAM
00979 
00980 //
00981 // Handle to interface provider
00982 //
00983 
00984 typedef U32 HPROVIDER;
00985 
00986 //
00987 // Handle representing token used to obtain attribute or preference
00988 // data from RIB provider
00989 //
00990 
00991 typedef U32 HATTRIB;
00992 
00993 //
00994 // Handle representing an enumerated interface entry
00995 //
00996 // RIB_enumerate_interface() returns 1 if valid next entry found, else
00997 // 0 if end of list reached
00998 //
00999 
01000 typedef U32 HINTENUM;
01001 #define HINTENUM_FIRST 0
01002 
01003 //
01004 // Handle representing an enumerated provider entry
01005 //
01006 // RIB_enumerate_providers() returns 1 if valid next entry found, else
01007 // 0 if end of list reached
01008 //
01009 
01010 typedef U32 HPROENUM;
01011 #define HPROENUM_FIRST 0
01012 
01013 //
01014 // Data types for RIB attributes and preferences
01015 //
01016 
01017 typedef enum
01018 {
01019    RIB_NONE = 0, // No type
01020    RIB_CUSTOM,   // Used for pointers to application-specific structures
01021    RIB_DEC,      // Used for 32-bit integer values to be reported in decimal
01022    RIB_HEX,      // Used for 32-bit integer values to be reported in hex
01023    RIB_FLOAT,    // Used for 32-bit single-precision FP values
01024    RIB_PERCENT,  // Used for 32-bit single-precision FP values to be reported as percentages
01025    RIB_BOOL,     // Used for Boolean-constrained integer values to be reported as TRUE or FALSE
01026    RIB_STRING    // Used for pointers to null-terminated ASCII strings
01027 }
01028 RIB_DATA_SUBTYPE;
01029 
01030 //
01031 // RIB_ENTRY_TYPE structure, used to register an interface or request one
01032 //
01033 
01034 typedef enum
01035 {
01036    RIB_FUNCTION = 0,
01037    RIB_ATTRIBUTE,     // Attribute: read-only data type used for status/info communication
01038    RIB_PREFERENCE     // Preference: read/write data type used to control behavior
01039 }
01040 RIB_ENTRY_TYPE;
01041 
01042 //
01043 // RIB_INTERFACE_ENTRY, used to represent a function or data entry in an
01044 // interface
01045 //
01046 
01047 typedef struct
01048 {
01049    RIB_ENTRY_TYPE   type;        // See list above
01050    C8 FAR          *entry_name;  // Name of desired function or attribute
01051    U32              token;       // Function pointer or attribute token
01052    RIB_DATA_SUBTYPE subtype;     // Data (attrib or preference) subtype
01053 }
01054 RIB_INTERFACE_ENTRY;
01055 
01056 //
01057 // Standard RAD Interface Broker provider identification attributes
01058 //
01059 
01060 #define PROVIDER_NAME    (-100)  // RIB_STRING name of decoder
01061 #define PROVIDER_VERSION (-101)  // RIB_HEX BCD version number
01062 
01063 //
01064 // Standard function to obtain provider attributes (see PROVIDER_ defines
01065 // above)
01066 //
01067 // Each provider of a searchable interface must export this function
01068 //
01069 
01070 typedef U32 (AILCALL FAR *PROVIDER_QUERY_ATTRIBUTE) (HATTRIB index);
01071 
01072 //
01073 // Macros to simplify interface registrations/requests for functions,
01074 // attributes, and preferences
01075 //
01076 
01077 #define FN(entry_name)        { RIB_FUNCTION, #entry_name, (U32) &(entry_name), RIB_NONE }
01078 #define REG_FN(entry_name)    { RIB_FUNCTION, #entry_name, (U32) &(entry_name), RIB_NONE }
01079 
01080 #define AT(entry_name,ID)             { RIB_ATTRIBUTE, (entry_name), (U32) &(ID), RIB_NONE }
01081 #define REG_AT(entry_name,ID,subtype) { RIB_ATTRIBUTE, (entry_name), (U32)  (ID), subtype  }
01082 
01083 #define PR(entry_name,ID)             { RIB_PREFERENCE, (entry_name), (U32) &(ID), RIB_NONE }
01084 #define REG_PR(entry_name,ID,subtype) { RIB_PREFERENCE, (entry_name), (U32)  (ID), subtype  }
01085 
01086 #define RIB_register(x,y,z)   RIB_register_interface  (HPROVIDER(x), y, ARY_CNT(z), z)
01087 #define RIB_unregister(x,y,z) RIB_unregister_interface(HPROVIDER(x), y, ARY_CNT(z), z)
01088 #define RIB_unregister_all(x) RIB_unregister_interface(HPROVIDER(x), NULL, 0, NULL)
01089 #define RIB_free_libraries()  RIB_free_provider_library(HPROVIDER(NULL));
01090 #define RIB_request(x,y,z)    RIB_request_interface   (x, y, ARY_CNT(z), z)
01091

01180 #ifndef MSS_ASI_VERSION // MSSASI.H contents included if MSSASI.H not already included
01181 
01182 // #include "mssasi.h"
01183 
01184 #define AIL_ASI_VERSION  1
01185 #define AIL_ASI_REVISION 0
01186 
01187 //
01188 // Handle to stream being managed by ASI codec
01189 //
01190 
01191 typedef S32 HASISTREAM;
01192 
01193 //
01194 // ASI result codes
01195 //
01196 
01197 typedef S32 ASIRESULT;
01198 
01199 #define ASI_NOERR                   0   // Success -- no error
01200 #define ASI_NOT_ENABLED             1   // ASI not enabled
01201 #define ASI_ALREADY_STARTED         2   // ASI already started
01202 #define ASI_INVALID_PARAM           3   // Invalid parameters used
01203 #define ASI_INTERNAL_ERR            4   // Internal error in ASI driver
01204 #define ASI_OUT_OF_MEM              5   // Out of system RAM
01205 #define ASI_ERR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED     6   // Feature not implemented
01206 #define ASI_NOT_FOUND               7   // ASI supported device not found
01207 #define ASI_NOT_INIT                8   // ASI not initialized
01208 #define ASI_CLOSE_ERR               9   // ASI not closed correctly
01209 
01210 // ----------------------------------
01211 // Application-provided ASI callbacks
01212 // ----------------------------------
01213 
01214 //
01215 // AILASIFETCHCB: Called by ASI to obtain data from stream source
01216 //
01217 // offset normally will be either 0 at the first call made by the codec
01218 // or -1 to specify a continuous stream, except when ASI_stream_seek()
01219 // is called to restart the stream codec at a new stream offset.  In this
01220 // case, the application must execute the seek operation on the ASI codec's
01221 // behalf.
01222 //
01223 // In response to this callback, the application should read the requested
01224 // data and copy it to the specified destination buffer, returning the number
01225 // of bytes copied (which can be less than bytes_requested if the end of
01226 // the stream is reached).
01227 //
01228 
01229 typedef S32 (AILCALLBACK FAR * AILASIFETCHCB) (U32       user,            // User value passed to ASI_open_stream()
01230                                                void FAR *dest,            // Location to which stream data should be copied by app
01231                                                S32       bytes_requested, // # of bytes requested by ASI codec
01232                                                S32       offset);         // If not -1, application should seek to this point in stream
01233 
01234 //############################################################################
01235 //##                                                                        ##
01236 //## Interface "ASI codec"                                                  ##
01237 //##                                                                        ##
01238 //############################################################################
01239 
01240 //
01241 // Initialize ASI stream codec
01242 //
01243 // No other ASI functions may be called outside an ASI_startup() /
01244 // ASI_shutdown() pair, except for the standard RIB function
01245 // PROVIDER_query_attribute().  All provider attributes must be accessible
01246 // without starting up the codec.
01247 //
01248 
01249 typedef ASIRESULT (AILCALL FAR *ASI_STARTUP)(void);
01250 
01251 //
01252 // Shut down ASI codec
01253 //
01254 
01255 typedef ASIRESULT (AILCALL FAR * ASI_SHUTDOWN)(void);
01256 
01257 //
01258 // Return codec error message, or NULL if no errors have occurred since
01259 // last call
01260 //
01261 // The ASI error text state is global to all streams
01262 //
01263 
01264 typedef C8 FAR *  (AILCALL FAR * ASI_ERROR)(void);
01265 
01266 //############################################################################
01267 //##                                                                        ##
01268 //## Interface "ASI stream"                                                 ##
01269 //##                                                                        ##
01270 //############################################################################
01271 
01272 //
01273 // Open a stream, returning handle to stream
01274 //
01275 
01276 typedef HASISTREAM (AILCALL FAR *ASI_STREAM_OPEN) (U32           user,              // User value passed to fetch callback
01277                                                    AILASIFETCHCB fetch_CB,          // Source data fetch handler
01278                                                    U32           total_size);       // Total size for %-done calculations (0=unknown)
01279 
01280 //
01281 // Translate data in stream, returning # of bytes actually decoded or encoded
01282 //
01283 // Any number of bytes may be requested.  Requesting more data than is
01284 // available in the codec's internal buffer will cause the AILASIFETCHCB
01285 // handler to be called to fetch more data from the stream.
01286 //
01287 
01288 typedef S32  (AILCALL FAR *ASI_STREAM_PROCESS) (HASISTREAM  stream,              // Handle of stream
01289                                                 void FAR   *buffer,              // Destination for processed data
01290                                                 S32         buffer_size);        // # of bytes to return in buffer
01291 
01292 //
01293 // Restart stream decoding process at new offset
01294 //
01295 // Relevant for decoders only
01296 //
01297 // Seek destination is given as offset in bytes from beginning of stream
01298 //
01299 // At next ASI_stream_process() call, decoder will seek to the closest possible
01300 // point in the stream which occurs at or after the specified position
01301 //
01302 // This function has no effect for decoders which do not support random 
01303 // seeks on a given stream type
01304 //
01305 // Warning: some decoders may need to implement seeking by reparsing
01306 // the entire stream up to the specified offset, through multiple calls
01307 // to the data-fetch callback.  This operation may be extremely
01308 // time-consuming on large files or slow network connections.
01309 //
01310 // A stream_offset value of -1 may be used to inform the decoder that the
01311 // application has changed the input stream offset on its own, e.g. for a
01312 // double-buffering application where the ASI decoder is not accessing the
01313 // stream directly.  ASI decoders should respond to this by flushing all
01314 // internal buffers and resynchronizing themselves to the data stream.
01315 //
01316 
01317 typedef ASIRESULT (AILCALL FAR *ASI_STREAM_SEEK)    (HASISTREAM stream,
01318                                                      S32        stream_offset);
01319 
01320 //
01321 // Retrieve an ASI stream attribute or preference value by index
01322 //
01323 
01324 typedef S32 (AILCALL FAR *ASI_STREAM_ATTRIBUTE) (HASISTREAM stream,
01325                                                  HATTRIB    attrib);
01326 
01327 //
01328 // Set an ASI stream preference value by index
01329 //
01330 
01331 typedef S32 (AILCALL FAR *ASI_STREAM_SET_PREFERENCE) (HASISTREAM stream,

01372 #define M3D_INTERNAL_ERR            4   // Internal error in M3D driver

01528 //############################################################################
01529 //##                                                                        ##
01530 //## Interface "MSS mixer services"                                         ##
01531 //##                                                                        ##
01532 //############################################################################
01533 
01534 //
01535 // Operation flags used by mixer module
01536 //
01537 
01538 #define M_DEST_STEREO 1       // Set to enable stereo mixer output
01539 #define M_SRC_16      2       // Set to enable mixing of 16-bit samples
01540 #define M_FILTER      4       // Set to enable filtering when resampling
01541 #define M_SRC_STEREO  8       // Set to enable mixing of stereo input samples
01542 #define M_VOL_SCALING 16      // Set to enable volume scalars other than 2047
01543 #define M_RESAMPLE    32      // Set to enable playback ratios other than 65536
01544 #define M_ORDER       64      // Set to reverse L/R stereo order for sample
01545 
01546 #ifdef IS_32
01547 
01548 //
01549 // Initialize mixer
01550 //
01551 // No other mixer functions may be called outside a MIXER_startup() /
01552 // MIXER_shutdown() pair, except for the standard RIB function
01553 // PROVIDER_query_attribute().  All provider attributes must be accessible
01554 // without starting up the module.
01555 //
01556 
01557 typedef void (AILCALL FAR *MIXER_STARTUP)(void);
01558 
01559 //
01560 // Shut down mixer
01561 //
01562 
01563 typedef void (AILCALL FAR *MIXER_SHUTDOWN)(void);
01564 
01565 //
01566 // Flush mixer buffer
01567 //
01568 
01569 typedef void (AILCALL FAR *MIXER_FLUSH)   (S32 FAR *dest,
01570                                            S32      len,
01571                                            S32 FAR *reverb_buffer,
01572                                            S32      reverb_level
01573 #ifdef IS_X86
01574                                            ,U32             MMX_available
01575 #endif
01576                                            );
01577 
01578 //
01579 // Perform audio mixing operation
01580 //
01581 
01582 typedef void (AILCALL FAR *MIXER_MERGE)   (void const FAR * FAR *src,
01583                                            U32        FAR *src_fract,
01584                                            void const FAR *src_end,
01585                                            S32  FAR * FAR *dest,
01586                                            void FAR       *dest_end,
01587                                            S32  FAR       *left_val,
01588                                            S32  FAR       *right_val,
01589                                            S32             playback_ratio,
01590                                            S32             scale_left,
01591                                            S32             scale_right,
01592                                            U32             operation
01593 #ifdef IS_X86
01594                                            ,U32             MMX_available
01595 #endif
01596                                            );
01597 
01598 //
01599 // Translate mixer buffer contents to final output format
01600 //
01601 
01602 #ifdef IS_MAC
01603 
01604 typedef void (AILCALL FAR *MIXER_COPY) (void const FAR  *src,
01605                                         S32       src_len,
01606                                         void FAR *dest,
01607                                         U32       operation,
01608                                         U32       big_endian_output);
01609 #else
01610

01612                                         S32       src_len,
01613                                         void FAR *dest,

01615                                         U32       MMX_available);
01616 #endif
01617 #else
01618

01861 //
01862 // Digital pipeline stages
01863 //
01864 // These are the points at which external modules may be installed into
01865 // a given HSAMPLE or HDIGDRIVER's processing pipeline
01866 //
01867 
01868 typedef enum
01869 {
01870    DP_ASI_DECODER=0,   // Must be "ASI codec stream" provider
01871    DP_FILTER,        // Must be "MSS pipeline filter" provider
01872    DP_MERGE,         // Must be "MSS mixer" provider
01873    N_SAMPLE_STAGES,  // Placeholder for end of list (= # of valid stages)
01874    SAMPLE_ALL_STAGES // Used to signify all pipeline stages, for shutdown
01875 }
01876 SAMPLESTAGE;
01877 
01878 typedef enum
01879 {
01880    DP_FLUSH = 0,     // Must be "MSS mixer" provider
01881    DP_DEFAULT_FILTER, // Must be "MSS pipeline filter" provider (sets the default)
01882    DP_DEFAULT_MERGE,  // Must be "MSS mixer" provider (sets the default)
01883    DP_COPY,          // Must be "MSS mixer" provider
01884    N_DIGDRV_STAGES,  // Placeholder for end of list (= # of valid stages)
01885    DIGDRV_ALL_STAGES // Used to signify all pipeline stages, for shutdown
01886 }
01887 DIGDRVSTAGE;
01888

01955 {
01956    U32        device_ID;       // DS LPGUID or wave device ID
01957    U32        hardware_format; // e.g., DIG_F_STEREO_16
01958    U32        hardware_rate;   // e.g., 22050
01959    AILINCB    callback;        // Callback function to receive incoming data
01960    S32        buffer_size;     // Maximum # of bytes to be passed to callback (-1 to use DIG_INPUT_LATENCY)
01961    U32        user_data;       // this is a user defined value
01962 }
01963 AIL_INPUT_INFO;
01964

01993 typedef struct _SAMPLE           // Sample instance
01994 {
01995    char       tag[4];            // HSAM
01996 
01997    HDIGDRIVER driver;            // Driver for playback
01998 
01999    U32      status;              // SMP_ flags: _FREE, _DONE, _PLAYING
02000 
02001    void const FAR *start[2];     // Sample buffer address (W)
02002    U32       len  [2];           // Sample buffer size in bytes (W)
02003    U32       pos  [2];           // Index to next byte (R/W)
02004    U32       done [2];           // Nonzero if buffer with len=0 sent by app
02005    S32       reset_ASI [2];      // Reset the ASI decoder at the end of the buffer
02006 
02007    U32      src_fract;           // Fractional part of source address
02008    S32      left_val;            // Mixer source value from end of last buffer
02009    S32      right_val;           // Mixer source value from end of last buffer
02010 
02011    S32      current_buffer;      // Buffer # active (0/1)
02012    S32      last_buffer;         // Last active buffer (for double-buffering)
02013    S32      starved;             // Buffer stream has run out of data
02014 
02015    S32      loop_count;          // # of cycles-1 (1=one-shot, 0=indefinite)
02016    S32      loop_start;          // Starting offset of loop block (0=SOF)
02017    S32      loop_end;            // End offset of loop block (-1=EOF)
02018 
02019    S32      format;              // DIG_F format (8/16 bits, mono/stereo)
02020    U32      flags;               // DIG_PCM_SIGN / DIG_PCM_ORDER (stereo only)
02021 
02022    S32      playback_rate;       // Playback rate in hertz
02023 
02024    S32      volume;              // Sample volume 0-127
02025    S32      pan;                 // Mono panpot/stereo balance (0=L ... 127=R)
02026 
02027    S32      left_scale;          // Left/mono volume scalar 0-2047
02028    S32      right_scale;         // Right volume scalar 0-2047
02029 
02030    S32      service_type;        // 1 if single-buffered; 2 if streamed
02031 
02032    AILSAMPLECB  SOB;             // Start-of-block callback function
02033    AILSAMPLECB  EOB;             // End-of-buffer callback function
02034    AILSAMPLECB  EOS;             // End-of-sample callback function
02035 
02036    S32      user_data  [8];      // Miscellaneous user data
02037    S32      system_data[8];      // Miscellaneous system data
02038 
02039    ADPCMDATA adpcm;
02040 
02041 #ifdef IS_WINDOWS
02042 
02043    S32      SOB_IsWin32s;        // Is this a Win32s callback
02044    S32      EOB_IsWin32s;        // Is this a Win32s callback
02045    S32      EOS_IsWin32s;        // Is this a Win32s callback
02046 
02047    //
02048    // DirectSound-specific data
02049    //
02050 
02051    S32      secondary_buffer;    // Secondary buffer index
02052 
02053    S32      service_interval;    // Service sample every n ms
02054    S32      service_tick;        // Current service countdown value
02055    S32      buffer_segment_size; // Buffer segment size to fill
02056 
02057    S32      prev_segment;        // Previous segment # (0...n)
02058    S32      prev_cursor;         // Previous play cursor location
02059 
02060    S32      bytes_remaining;     // # of bytes left to play (if not -1)
02061 
02062    S32      direct_control;      // 1 if app controls buffer, 0 if MSS
02063 
02064 #endif
02065 
02066    S32      doeob;               // Flags to trigger callbacks
02067    S32      dosob;
02068    S32      doeos;
02069 
02070    //
02071    // Sample pipeline stages
02072    //
02073 
02074    DPINFO   pipeline[N_SAMPLE_STAGES];
02075 
02076    //
02077    // Reverb parms
02078    //
02079 
02080    F32      reverb_level;           // Level [0.0, 1.0]
02081    F32      reverb_reflect_time;    // Reflect time in milliseconds
02082    F32      reverb_decay_time;      // Decay time [0.1, 20.0]
02083    S32      base_scale;             // Original 12-bit volume scalar
02084 }
02085 SAMPLE;

02584 typedef struct                      // XMIDI TIMB IFF chunk
02585    {
02586    S8    name[4];
02587 
02588    U8    msb;
02589    U8    lsb;
02590    U8    lsb2;
02591    U8    lsb3;
02592 
02593    U16   n_entries;
02594 
02595    U16   timbre[1];
02596    }
02597 TIMB_chunk;
02598 
02599 typedef struct                      // XMIDI RBRN IFF entry
02600    {
02601    S16   bnum;
02602    U32   offset;
02603    }
02604 RBRN_entry;
02605 
02606 typedef struct                      // Wave library entry
02607 {
02608    S32   bank;                      // XMIDI bank, MIDI patch for sample
02609    S32   patch;
02610 
02611    S32   root_key;                  // Root MIDI note # for sample (or -1)
02612 
02613    U32   file_offset;               // Offset of wave data from start-of-file
02614    U32   size;                      // Size of wave sample in bytes
02615 
02616    S32   format;                    // DIG_F format (8/16 bits, mono/stereo)
02617    U32   flags;                     // DIG_PCM_SIGN / DIG_PCM_ORDER (stereo)
02618    S32   playback_rate;             // Playback rate in hertz
02619 }
02620 WAVE_ENTRY;
02621 
02622 typedef struct                      // Virtual "wave synthesizer" descriptor
02623 {
02624    HMDIDRIVER mdi;                  // MIDI driver for use with synthesizer
02625    HDIGDRIVER dig;                  // Digital driver for use with synthesizer
02626 
02627    WAVE_ENTRY FAR *library;         // Pointer to wave library
02628 
02629    AILEVENTCB  prev_event_fn;       // Previous MIDI event trap function
02630    AILTIMBRECB prev_timb_fn;        // Previous timbre request trap function
02631 
02632    CTRL_LOG    controls;            // MIDI controller states
02633 
02634    WAVE_ENTRY FAR *wave [NUM_CHANS];// Pointer to WAVE_ENTRY for each channel
02635 
02636    HSAMPLE     S    [MAX_W_VOICES]; // List of HSAMPLE voices
02637    S32         n_voices;            // Actual # of voices allocated to synth
02638 
02639    S32         chan [MAX_W_VOICES]; // MIDI channel for each voice, or -1
02640    S32         note [MAX_W_VOICES]; // MIDI note number for voice
02641    S32         root [MAX_W_VOICES]; // MIDI root note for voice
02642    S32         rate [MAX_W_VOICES]; // Playback rate for voice
02643    S32         vel  [MAX_W_VOICES]; // MIDI note velocity for voice
02644    U32         time [MAX_W_VOICES]; // Timestamp for voice
02645 
02646    U32         event;               // Event counter for LRU timestamps
02647 }
02648 WAVE_SYNTH;
02649 
02650 typedef WAVE_SYNTH FAR * HWAVESYNTH;// Handle to virtual wave synthesizer

03021 #ifdef IS_WINDOWS
03022 
03023 #define AIL_MSS_version(str,len)        \
03024 {                                       \
03025   HINSTANCE l=LoadLibrary(MSSDLLNAME);  \
03026   if ((U32)l<=32)                       \
03027     *(str)=0;                           \
03028   else {                                \
03029     LoadString(l,1,str,len);            \
03030     FreeLibrary(l);                     \
03031   }                                     \
03032 }
03033 
03034 DXDEC  S32          AILCALL AIL_waveOutOpen          (HDIGDRIVER   FAR *drvr,
03035                                                       LPHWAVEOUT   FAR  *lphWaveOut,
03036                                                       S32             wDeviceID,
03037                                                       LPWAVEFORMAT      lpFormat);

03046 #else
03047 
03048 #ifdef IS_MAC
03049 
03050 typedef struct MSS_VersionType_
03051 {
03052   Str255 version_name;
03053 } MSS_VersionType;
03054 
03055 #define AIL_MSS_version(str,len)                        \
03056 {                                                       \
03057   long _res = OpenResFile("\pMiles Shared Library");    \
03058   if (_res==-1)                                         \
03059   {                                                     \
03060     str[0]=0;                                           \
03061   }                                                     \
03062   else                                                  \
03063   {                                                     \
03064     Handle _H;                                          \
03065     short _Err;                                         \
03066     long _cur= CurResFile();                            \
03067     UseResFile(_res);                                   \
03068     _H = GetResource('vers', 2);                        \
03069     _Err = ResError();                                  \
03070     if((_Err != noErr) || (_H==0))                      \
03071     {                                                   \
03072       str[0]=0;                                         \
03073       UseResFile(_cur);                                 \
03074       CloseResFile(_res);                               \
03075     }                                                   \
03076     else                                                \
03077     {                                                   \
03078       if (GetHandleSize(_H)==0)                         \
03079       {                                                 \
03080         str[0]=0;                                       \
03081         UseResFile(_cur);                               \
03082         CloseResFile(_res);                             \
03083       }                                                 \
03084       else                                              \
03085       {                                                 \
03086         MSS_VersionType * _vt = (MSS_VersionType*)*_H;  \
03087         if ((U32)_vt->version_name[6]>4)                \
03088           _vt->version_name[6]-=4;                      \
03089         else                                            \
03090           _vt->version_name[6]=0;                       \
03091         if (((U32)len) <= ((U32)_vt->version_name[6]))  \
03092           _vt->version_name[6] = (U8)len-1;             \
03093         memcpy( str, _vt->version_name+11, _vt->version_name[6] ); \
03094         str[_vt->version_name[6]]=0;                    \
03095         UseResFile(_cur);                               \
03096         CloseResFile(_res);                             \
03097       }                                                 \
03098       ReleaseResource(_H);                              \
03099     }                                                   \
03100   }                                                     \
03101 }
03102

03630 typedef struct _STREAM FAR* HSTREAM;           // Handle to stream
03631 
03632 typedef void (AILCALLBACK FAR* AILSTREAMCB)   (HSTREAM stream);
03633 
03634 typedef struct _STREAM {
03635 
03636   S32 block_oriented; // 1 if this is an ADPCM or ASI-compressed stream
03637   S32 using_ASI;      // 1 if using ASI decoder to uncompress stream data
03638   ASISTAGE FAR *ASI;  // handy pointer to our ASI coded
03639 
03640   HSAMPLE samp;       // the sample handle
03641 
03642   U32 fileh;          // the open file handle
03643 
03644   U8 FAR* bufs[3];    // the data buffers
03645   U32 bufsizes[3];    // the size of each buffer
03646   S32 reset_ASI[3];   // should we reset the ASI at the end of the buffer?
03647   S32 bufstart[3];    // offset of where this buffer started
03648   void FAR* asyncs[3];// async read structures
03649 
03650   S32 loadedbufstart[2]; // offset of where the loaded buffer started
03651   S32 loadedorder[2]; // order of the buffers as they were loaded
03652   S32 loadorder;      // incremented as each buffer is loaded
03653 
03654   S32 bufsize;        // size of each buffer
03655   S32 readsize;       // size of each read block
03656 
03657   U32 buf1;           // 0,1,2 (current buffer that we are reading into)
03658   S32 size1;          // holds the current amount of data read
03659 
03660   U32 buf2;           // 0,1,2 (the next buffer that we are reading into)
03661   S32 size2;          // next buffer loaded up to
03662 
03663   U32 buf3;           // 0,1,2 (the next buffer that we are reading into)
03664   S32 size3;          // next buffer loaded up to
03665 
03666   U32 datarate;       // datarate in bytes per second
03667   S32 filerate;       // original datarate of the file
03668   S32 filetype;       // file format type
03669   U32 fileflags;      // file format flags (signed or unsigned)
03670   S32 totallen;       // total length of the sound data
03671 
03672   S32 substart;       // subblock loop start
03673   S32 sublen;         // subblock loop len
03674   S32 subpadding;     // amount to pad the final block
03675 
03676   U32 blocksize;      // ADPCM block size
03677   S32 padding;        // padding to be done
03678   S32 padded;         // padding done
03679 
03680   S32 loadedsome;     // have we done any loads?
03681 
03682   U32 startpos;       // point that the sound data begins
03683   U32 totalread;      // total bytes read from the disk
03684 
03685   U32 loopsleft;      // how many loops are left
03686 
03687   U32 error;          // read error has occurred
03688 
03689   S32 preload;        // preload the file into the first buffer
03690   U32 preloadpos;     // position to use in preload
03691   S32 noback;         // no background processing
03692   S32 alldone;        // alldone
03693   S32 primeamount;    // amount to load after a seek
03694   S32 readatleast;    // forced amount to read on next service
03695 
03696   S32 playcontrol;    // control: 0=stopped, 1=started, |8=paused, |16=sample paused
03697 
03698   AILSTREAMCB callback;  // end of stream callback
03699 
03700   S32 user_data[8];   // Miscellaneous user data
03701   void FAR* next;     // pointer to next stream
03702 
03703 #if defined(IS_WINDOWS) || defined(IS_MAC)
03704   S32 autostreaming;  // are we autostreaming this stream
03705 #endif
03706 
03707 #ifdef IS_WINDOWS
03708   S32 cb_IsWin32s;    // Is the callback win32s?
03709 #endif
03710 
03711   S32 docallback;     // set when it time to poll for a callback
03712 
03713 #ifdef IS_MAC
03714   IOParam  stream_param;
03715   S32      donext;
03716   S32      donext1;
03717   U32      fillup;
03718   U32      session;
03719   U32      tamt;
03720   U32      buf;
03721   S32*     size;
03722   S32*     done;
03723   S32      done1;
03724   S32      done2;
03725   S32      done3;
03726   Boolean  force_quit;
03727 #endif
03728 
03729 } MSTREAM_TYPE;
03730 
03731

03817 #define AIL_FILE_SEEK_BEGIN   0
03818 #define AIL_FILE_SEEK_CURRENT 1
03819 #define AIL_FILE_SEEK_END     2

04224 //
04225 // Filter result codes
04226 //
04227 
04228 typedef S32 FLTRESULT;
04229 
04230 #define FLT_NOERR                   0   // Success -- no error
04231 #define FLT_NOT_ENABLED             1   // FLT not enabled
04232 #define FLT_ALREADY_STARTED         2   // FLT already started
04233 #define FLT_INVALID_PARAM           3   // Invalid parameters used
04234 #define FLT_INTERNAL_ERR            4   // Internal error in FLT driver
04235 #define FLT_OUT_OF_MEM              5   // Out of system RAM
04236 #define FLT_ERR_NOT_IMPLEMENTED     6   // Feature not implemented
04237 #define FLT_NOT_FOUND               7   // FLT supported device not found
04238 #define FLT_NOT_INIT                8   // FLT not initialized
04239 #define FLT_CLOSE_ERR               9   // FLT not closed correctly
04240 
04241 //############################################################################
04242 //##                                                                        ##
04243 //## Interface "MSS pipeline filter"                                        ##
04244 //##                                                                        ##
04245 //############################################################################
04246 
04247 typedef FLTRESULT (AILCALL FAR *FLT_STARTUP)(void);
04248 
04249 typedef FLTRESULT (AILCALL FAR *FLT_SHUTDOWN)(void);
04250 
04251 typedef C8 FAR *  (AILCALL FAR *FLT_ERROR)(void);

04254                                                              void const FAR*   value);
04255

04258                                                      S32        build_buffer_size);

04263 #ifdef IS_MAC
04264                                                        ,U32 buffer_size
04265 #endif
04266 );

04563 //
04564 // Changed the definition of distances to only be max and min, vs. front
04565 //   min/max and back min/max.  Only RSX supported the concept of different
04566 //   front and distances, so we changed the API to make it more orthogonal
04567 //   to most of the 3D providers. Sorry in advance.
04568 //
